jfxtras.scene.layout

Class VBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.VBox
              • jfxtras.scene.layout.VBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class VBox
extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox

    A drop-in replacement for JavaFX’s VBox using layout constraints. So instead of:

            VBox lVBox = new VBox(5.0);
        Button b1 = new Button("short");
        lVBox.getChildren().add(b1);
        VBox.setVgrow(b1, Priority.ALWAYS);

    You can write:

            VBox lVBox = new VBox(5.0);
        lVBox.add(new Button("short"), new VBox.C().vgrow(Priority.ALWAYS));

    This class is not a reimplementation of VBox, but only applies a different API.
